text: Control schematics, network diagrams, sequence of operations reviewed and approved by engineer
BAS panel locations coordinated with electrical rooms/mechanical areas and labeled per drawings
Network protocol confirmed (BACnet/IP, MSTP, Modbus, LonWorks, KNX, etc.) and devices properly mapped
BAS panels mounted level, accessible, with nameplates, documentation pockets, and lockable doors
All I/O points wired per schematics, tagged, terminated, and free of interference
Shielded cabling, grounding, conduit penetrations sealed, and low-voltage segregation maintained
Sensors (temperature, humidity, CO2, occupancy) installed per schedule and calibrated
Damper actuators, valve actuators, and flow meters installed, tested for stroke and feedback
Fire alarm and life safety interlocks connected and labeled

id: D. Programming, Graphics, and Control Logic

text: Control programs uploaded, verified per sequence, and override protection enabled
User interface (graphics) reviewed for navigation, points labeling, and trend logs
Alarms configured for priority, email/text alerts, and event triggers
Full point-to-point test completed (input/output validation) with signed off matrix
Trending and logging confirmed for energy usage, setpoints, and occupancy behavior
Operator training conducted and login credentials handed over securely
As-built control drawings, network diagram, backups, and user manuals submitted

id: • ASHRAE Guideline 13, BACnet Standard 135, ANSI/ASHRAE 135.1, CSA C22.1
• Manufacturer Specs: Johnson Controls, Honeywell, Siemens, Schneider, Delta Controls, Tridium Niagara
